raw_text:
Roxy Music on Isle of Wight bill
 
 Roxy Music will appear at June's Isle of Wight music festival, along with Morrissey, Supergrass and Idlewild.
 
 REM have already been confirmed as headliners for the three-day event, which takes place from 10-12 June. Original band members Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzerana, Andy Mackay and Paul Thompson will take to the stage on the Saturday night of the festival. The band are also working in the studio on new material, their first since the 1982 album Avalon. Roxy Music were formed in 1971 by Ferry, Mackay and Brian Eno, with Manzanera joining the following year. Their first hit was 1972's Virginia Plain, with other hits including Street Life, Love Is The Drug and the 1981 John Lennon cover, Jealous Guy. Roxy Music's back catalogue was re-released in 2000, leading to the band undertaking a world tour in 2001. Morrissey will also play on Saturday at the festival, while Supergrass and Idlewild have been confirmed for the Friday.

The band's original members will take the stage on Saturday night, featuring Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzanera, Andy Mackay, and Paul Thompson.

The band has an extensive back catalogue of hits from 1970s to the present, including "Street Life," "Love Is The Drug," and their 1981 cover of "Jealous Guy." Roxy Music's re-release of their first hit, "Virginia Plain, " helped lead to a world tour in 2001. Morrissey will perform on Saturday at the festival, while Supergrass and Idlewild have also been confirmed for the Friday night show.

The band has new material in the studio; previously hits include Virginia Plain, Street Life, Love Is The Drug, and John Lennon cover Jealous Guy.

Roxy Music was formed in 1971 by Ferry, Mackay, Eno (with Manzanera joining later), known for hits like Virginia Plain, Street Life, Love Is The Drug, and Jealous Guy. Their catalogue was re-released in 2000, leading to a world tour in 2001. Morrissey will also play on Saturday, with Supergrass and Idlewild confirmed for Friday.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Roxy Music's appearance at the Isle of Wight music festival. Let me read through the provided text first.

The main points are that Roxy Music is performing on the sixth day, along with Morrissey and Supergrass. The event runs from June 10th to 12th, so they'll have three days. They've already confirmed REM as the mainliners for the full three-day festival. There's a lot about the band members: Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzerana, Andy Mackay, Paul Thompson. I know they started with Ferry, Manzerana, and Brian Eno in 1971, then added more members each year. Their early hits include Virginia Plain, Love Is The Drug, and the John Lennon cover. They've been touring since 2001.

So, I need to create a summary that includes all these details but in a concise way. I should mention Roxy Music's lineup on Saturday night with their new material, the band members, the first hits they had, and the tour they've done. Also include that REM are confirmed as mainliners for the three days.

I have to make sure not to add any explanations or extra information beyond summarizing key ideas and details. Just plain text. So I'll list each main point clearly without getting too detailed.

Roxy Music will perform on the sixth day of the Isle of Wight music festival, with Morrissey and Supergrass also participating. REM have confirmed their support for the three-day event, which runs from June 10th to 12th. The band members include Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzerana, Andy Mackay, and Paul Thompson, who started with Ferry, Manzerana, and Brian Eno in 1971 and expanded since then. Roxy Music' early hits include Virginia Plain, Love Is The Drug, and the John Lennon cover, released in 2000. They have a world tour since 2001.
tinyllama:1.1b: Roxy Music will perform at Isle of Wiight music festival, alongside Morrissey and Supergraff, on the Saturday night. Original band members Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzerana, Andy Mackay and Paul Thompson are set to take the stage on the Saturday evening, with new material also reportedly in the works for a forthcoming studio album. Roxy Music was formed in 1971 by Ferry, Mackay, Eno, Manzanera and Thompson, with other hits including "Virginia Plain" (1972) and "Street Life" (1974). Their 1981 hit single, "Jealous Guy," was also a success. Roxy Music's back catalogue was released in 2000, with a tour of the same year also taking place. Morrissey will play on Saturday night at the festival, while Supergraff and Idlewiild are also confirmed for the Friday.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Roxy Music is set to perform at the Isle of Wight music festival, along with iconic bands Morrissey, Supergrass, and Idlewild. The three-day event will take place on June 10th - 12th, in the picturesque Isle of Wight. The original band members, Bryan Ferry, Phil Manzerana, Andy Mackay, and Paul Thompson will join the stage for the Saturday night performance. Roxy Music was formed in 1971 by Ferry, Mackay, and Brian Eno, with Manzanera joining the following year. Their first hit was Virginia Plain, followed by other classics like Street Life, Love Is The Drug, and Jealous Guy. 

The re-release of their back catalogue in 2000 led to a world tour in 2001, with Morrissey joining the band on Saturday at the festival. Supergrass and Idlewild have also been confirmed for the Friday.
